gw.api.util

Class MonetaryAmounts

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.util.MonetaryAmounts

  • public class MonetaryAmounts
extends java.lang.Object
    MonetaryAmount Utility methods for creation, conversion, and rounding.

        public static boolean isGreaterThanOrEqualTo(MonetaryAmount first,
                                             MonetaryAmount second)
        Parameters:
        first - the first value to test
        second - the second value to test
        Returns:
        true if the first MonetaryAmount is greater than or equal to the second, ignoring scale.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if both currency amounts specify a different non-null currency

        Returns:

      • isEqualIgnoringScale

        public static boolean isEqualIgnoringScale(@Nullable
                                           MonetaryAmount first,
                                           @Nullable
                                           MonetaryAmount second)
        Parameters:
        first - the first value to test
        second - the second value to test
        Returns:
        true if the first MonetaryAmount is equal to the second, ignoring scale. False if the currencies are incompatible.

      • isSameSign

        public static boolean isSameSign(MonetaryAmount first,
                                 MonetaryAmount second)
        Parameters:
        first - the first value to test
        second - the second value to test
        Returns:
        true if the two monetary amounts are both positive or both negative. Ignores scale and currency values.

      • render

        public static java.lang.String render(@Nullable
                                      MonetaryAmount currencyAmount)
        Renders the given MonetaryAmount to a user displayable String that is formatted appropriately to be included in user messages. This does not use the localization setting CurrencyFormat.zeroValue for zero currencyAmounts.
        Parameters:
        currencyAmount - the MonetaryAmount
        Returns:
        a localized user displayable String for the MonetaryAmount

      • renderForInput

        public static java.lang.String renderForInput(@Nullable
                                              MonetaryAmount currencyAmount)
        Renders the given MonetaryAmount to a String formatted for editing
        Parameters:
        currencyAmount - the MonetaryAmount
        Returns:
        a localized String (formatted for editing) for the MonetaryAmount

      • calculatePercentage

        public static java.math.BigDecimal calculatePercentage(MonetaryAmount portion,
                                                       MonetaryAmount total,
                                                       java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Parameters:
        portion - the value which will be converted to a percentage
        total - the total amount which represents 100%
        roundingMode - the RoundingMode to use when dividing
        Returns:
        the percentage portion/total * 100, rounded to a scale of 3 using the given RoundingMode. Returns 100.00 if total is zero.

      • roundToCurrencyScale

        public static MonetaryAmount roundToCurrencyScale(MonetaryAmount amount,
                                                  java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Round to the scale/fraction digits (i.e. storageScale) for the MonetaryAmount's currency. A null currency arg will round to the storageScale of the default currency.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to be rounded
        roundingMode - the RoundingMode to use when rounding
        Returns:
        the rounded value in the appropriate scale for the given currency

      • roundToCurrencyScale

        public static MonetaryAmount roundToCurrencyScale(java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                                                  Currency currency,
                                                  java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Round to the scale/fraction digits (i.e. storageScale) for the MonetaryAmount's currency. A null currency arg will round to the storageScale of the default currency. A null amount will cause this method to return null.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to be rounded
        currency - the currency to use for the scale calculation
        roundingMode - the RoundingMode to use when rounding
        Returns:
        the rounded value in the appropriate scale for the given currency

      • zeroIfNull

        public static MonetaryAmount zeroIfNull(@Nullable
                                        MonetaryAmount currencyAmount)
        Parameters:
        currencyAmount - the amount
        Returns:
        zero of the default currency if currencyAmount is null, otherwise the given currencyAmount

      • sumToDefaultCurrency

        public static MonetaryAmount sumToDefaultCurrency(MonetaryAmount[] currencyAmounts)
        Parameters:
        currencyAmounts - the list of amounts to sum
        Returns:
        the sum of all currencyAmounts
